intro: Lespedeza hirta var. sparsiflora, commonly known as narrowleaf sericea, is a perennial flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are pink to purple in color. Lespedeza hirta var. sparsiflora is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to fix nitrogen and stabilize soil.
